title: Obong Okon
author: Obong Okon
content: As a newbie, I always login to check if my forum account is still intact. I want to know if it's possible for my account to be hacked.

comments.author: _morghulis
comments.created_time: September 29, 2022, 09:38:11 AMLast edit: September 29, 2022, 09:52:42 AM by _morghulis
comments.body: Yes it can, but only when you're careless with your login details.We have several webpages that are designed to look exactly like Bitcointalk if you're not vigilant enough to take note of the web url you might think it's the actual Bitcointalk forum and if you should try to login into the fake bttalk your login details might get stolen. And it doesn't only apply to bttalk alone. There have been cases where users receive email containing phishing link and since most of them ain't acquainted with how to identify a phishing link it lead to them exposing some sensitive information that should have been kept private, for example Credit cards number, Wallet secret phrases, private key etc...But just leaving your account idle without using it or exposing your login details I'm not sure if it'll be that easy for it to get hacked.  update:By searching "phishing quizzes site:Bitcointalk.org" I was able to find this [LEARN & EARN] Phishing Quizzes - Beginners & Experts (You should consider checking out that thread if you want learn how to identify and prevent a phishing attack. ~Valar~

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: You can always also check your IP address that you are using to access this forum. If you start to see the ones that are different from yours, that means another user login into your bitcoin account. https://bitcointalk.org/myips.phpAlso better to stake your bitcoin address in case of anything like hack happenshttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=996318.0

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Obong Okon on September 29, 2022, 09:29:31 AMAs a newbie, I always login to check if my forum account is still intact. I want to know if it's possible for my account to be hacked.Yes, it is. As said, the easiest is phishing sites impersonating bitcointalk.A very important part is to learn how to have your own local bitcoin wallet, how to sign a message with an address of your wallet (see here, easiest may be with Electrum), then stake your address. This will help you recover your account if it's hacked.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: The matter should be quite simple, and at least it is for me all these years that I have been on the forum. It's not some great wisdom, nor does it require you to be some kind of super IT expert. When you are sure that you are on a legitimate forum, simply save that link in your bookmarks browser, and use only that link to visit the forum.Use a special e-mail that will be connected only to this forum, and set a unique and sufficiently complex password for that e-mail.The password you will use to log in to the forum should also be unique and should contain random characters (lowercase and uppercase letters, numbers and special characters of at least 10+ characters).Save all this data offline and never share it with anyone, which means that you do not log into the forum via public Wi-Fi or shared computers.Refrain from downloading risky content and visiting sites that may contain malware/viruses - and do not click on suspicious links in your e-mail.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: Obong Okon on September 29, 2022, 09:29:31 AM<…>The answer is always going to be yes (possible), and up to a certain degree, it will be up to you how likely it may be to happen. Some of the posts above already give pointers to pre-emptive measures you can take.There is also a topic on what to do where it to happen. Reading through you’ll see that staking a bitcoin address you fully control (i.e. generally one from a non-custodial wallet), from which you can sign a message, is one of the centre piece in account recoveries. (PGP is a valid alternative, but most go with the bitcoin staked address).

I want to know if it's possible for my account to be hacked.You wrote only three posts in bitcointalk forum and you are so concerned about your account getting hacked? C'mon man  It's not like you are hiding top secret information here, but yes everything can be hacked including forum account and it's mostly happening by owners mistake with phishing attacks.Just be careful when opening any pages, check address bar, don't click any links in messages from unknown people, and you will be just fine.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Quote from: Obong Okon on September 29, 2022, 09:29:31 AMAs a newbie, I always login to check if my forum account is still intact.Check the record of your login IPs with this link https://bitcointalk.org/myips.phpQuoteI want to know if it's possible for my account to be hacked.It can be hacked. Depends on how careless or careful you are with your devices and how strong or weak your account password is.Make sure you turn on 2FA of the email you used to register your forum account. Default, your email address is hidden at your profile page, remember don't turn it on. If you turn it on, your email will become target of spams, phishing attacks, scam attacks.[GUIDE] How to Create a Strong/Secure Password

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: If you are too concerned about the security of your account, then you have seen examples of hacks? Isn't it? The above are great tips that you can use, but I would add a little more. After visiting the forum, always delete the cookies that are stored in the browser. It is advisable to delete everything so that if hackers get your browser data, they cannot get anything. I never open a forum and any other new sites I don't know, at the same time. Try splitting your sessions, or just use a different browser. In addition, do not decorate the browser with different extensions, which can also be dangerous.
